us.ihmc.euclid.referenceFrame

Class FrameConvexPolygon2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.ihmc.euclid.referenceFrame.FrameConvexPolygon2D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConvexPolygon2DBasics, ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly, Vertex2DSupplier, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.EpsilonComparable<FrameConvexPolygon2D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometricallyComparable<FrameConvexPolygon2D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometryObject<FrameConvexPolygon2D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Settable<FrameConvexPolygon2D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Transformable, FixedFrameConvexPolygon2DBasics, FrameChangeable, FrameConvexPolygon2DBasics, FrameConvexPolygon2DReadOnly, FrameVertex2DSupplier, ReferenceFrameHolder

    public class FrameConvexPolygon2D
extends java.lang.Object
implements FrameConvexPolygon2DBasics, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometryObject<FrameConvexPolygon2D>
    Describes a planar convex polygon defined in the XY-plane and that is expressed in a changeable reference frame.

    The vertices of a convex polygon are clockwise ordered and are all different.

    This implementation of convex polygon is designed for garbage free operations.

      • FrameConvexPolygon2D

        public FrameConvexPolygon2D(ReferenceFrame referenceFrame,
                            Vertex2DSupplier vertex2DSupplier)
        Creates a new convex polygon such that it represents the convex hull of all the points provided by the supplier.

        Note that the resulting polygon is ready to be used for any operations, no need to call update().

        Parameters:
        referenceFrame - the initial reference frame for this polygon.
        vertex2DSupplier - the supplier of vertices.
        See Also:
        FrameConvexPolygon2DBasics.setIncludingFrame(ReferenceFrame, Vertex2DSupplier)

      • FrameConvexPolygon2D

        public FrameConvexPolygon2D(FrameVertex2DSupplier firstVertex2DSupplier,
                            FrameVertex2DSupplier secondVertex2DSupplier)
        Creates a new convex polygon by combining the vertices from two suppliers. The result is the smallest convex hull that contains all the vertices provided by the two suppliers.

        Note that the resulting polygon is ready to be used for any operations, no need to call update().

        Parameters:
        firstVertex2DSupplier - the first supplier of vertices.
        secondVertex2DSupplier - the second supplier of vertices.
        See Also:
        FrameConvexPolygon2DBasics.setIncludingFrame(FrameVertex2DSupplier, FrameVertex2DSupplier)

        Specified by:

      • clear

        public void clear()
        After calling this method, the polygon has no vertex, area, or centroid.

        Note that this polygon is marked as being out-of-date. The method ConvexPolygon2DBasics.update() has to be called afterward before being able to perform operations with this polygon.

        Specified by:
        clear in interface ConvexPolygon2DBasics

      • clearAndUpdate

        public void clearAndUpdate()
        After calling this method, the polygon has no vertex, area, or centroid.

        Use only when an empty polygon is desired.

        Specified by:
        clearAndUpdate in interface ConvexPolygon2DBasics

      • addVertexMatchingFrame

        public void addVertexMatchingFrame(ReferenceFrame referenceFrame,
                                   us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly vertex,
                                   boolean checkIfTransformInXYPlane)
        Add a vertex to this polygon.

        If vertex is expressed in the frame as this, then this method is equivalent to ConvexPolygon2DBasics.addVertex(Point2DReadOnly).

        If vertex is expressed in a different frame than this, then the vertex is added once transformed to be expressed in this.getReferenceFrame().

        Specified by:
        addVertexMatchingFrame in interface FixedFrameConvexPolygon2DBasics
        Parameters:
        referenceFrame - the reference frame in which the given vertex is expressed.
        vertex - the new vertex. Not modified.
        checkIfTransformInXYPlane - whether this method should assert that the rotation part of the transform from the vertex's frame to this frame represents a transformation in the XY plane.
        See Also:
        ConvexPolygon2DBasics.addVertex(Point2DReadOnly)

      • addVertexMatchingFrame

        public void addVertexMatchingFrame(ReferenceFrame referenceFrame,
                                   us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DReadOnly vertex)
        Add a vertex to this polygon.

        If vertex is expressed in the frame as this, then this method is equivalent to ConvexPolygon2DBasics.addVertex(Point2DReadOnly).

        If vertex is expressed in a different frame than this, then the vertex is added once transformed to be expressed in this.getReferenceFrame().

        Specified by:
        addVertexMatchingFrame in interface FixedFrameConvexPolygon2DBasics
        Parameters:
        referenceFrame - the reference frame in which the given vertex is expressed.
        vertex - the new vertex. Not modified.
        See Also:
        ConvexPolygon2DBasics.addVertex(Point3DReadOnly)

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates the vertices so they represent a clockwise convex polygon.

        Call this method after editing the vertices of this polygon.

        Note that this also updates centroid, area and the bounding box of this polygon.

        Specified by:
        update in interface ConvexPolygon2DBasics

      • addVertex

        public void addVertex(double x,
                      double y)
        Add a vertex to this polygon.

        Note that this polygon is marked as being out-of-date. The method ConvexPolygon2DBasics.update() has to be called afterward before being able to perform operations with this polygon.

        Specified by:
        addVertex in interface ConvexPolygon2DBasics
        Parameters:

      • removeVertex

        public void removeVertex(int indexOfVertexToRemove)
        Removes the vertex of this polygon positioned at the index indexOfVertexToRemove.

        Note that this polygon is marked as being out-of-date. The method ConvexPolygon2DBasics.update() has to be called afterward before being able to perform operations with this polygon.

        Specified by:
        removeVertex in interface ConvexPolygon2DBasics
        Parameters:

      • changeFrame

        public void changeFrame(ReferenceFrame desiredFrame)
        Transforms this geometry such that the transformation represents the same geometry but from the perspective of another reference frame: desiredFrame.

        Once the geometry is transformed, the reference frame is updated to desiredFrame. In the case, this.referenceFrame == desiredFrame, this method does nothing.

        Specified by:
        changeFrame in interface FrameChangeable
        Parameters:
        desiredFrame - the reference frame in which this geometry is to be expressed.

      • changeFrameAndProjectToXYPlane

        public final void changeFrameAndProjectToXYPlane(ReferenceFrame desiredFrame)
        Performs a transformation of the polygon such that it is expressed in a new frame desireFrame.

        Because the transformation between two reference frames is a 3D transformation, the result of transforming this polygon's vertices 2D can result in vertices 3D. This method projects the result of the transformation onto the XY-plane.

        Specified by:
        changeFrameAndProjectToXYPlane in interface FrameConvexPolygon2DBasics
        Parameters:
        desiredFrame - the reference frame in which the polygon is to be expressed.

      • getVertexBufferView

        public java.util.List<? extends FramePoint2DReadOnly> getVertexBufferView()
        Gets a read-only view of this polygon internal vertex buffer.

        WARNING: The size of the returned list is usually greater than the size of this polygon. The vertices currently composing this polygon are located at the indices ∈ [0; this.getNumberOfVertices()[.

        The returned list is an unmodifiable list created with Collections.unmodifiableList(List).

        Specified by:
        getVertexBufferView in interface ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly
        Specified by:
        getVertexBufferView in interface FrameConvexPolygon2DReadOnly
        Returns:
        a read-only view of this polygon internal vertex buffer.

      • getCentroid

        public FramePoint2DReadOnly getCentroid()
        Gets the read-only reference to the polygon's centroid.

        The centroid is not necessarily equal to the average of this polygon's vertices.

        When viewing a polygon as a physical object with constant density and thickness, the centroid is equivalent to the polygon's center of mass.

        Specified by:
        getCentroid in interface ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly
        Specified by:
        getCentroid in interface FrameConvexPolygon2DReadOnly
        Returns:
        the read-only reference to this polygon's centroid.

      • isClockwiseOrdered

        public boolean isClockwiseOrdered()
        Tests whether the vertices of this polygon are clockwise or counter-clockwise ordered.
        Specified by:
        isClockwiseOrdered in interface ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly
        Returns:
        true if the vertices are clockwise ordered, false otherwise.

      • isUpToDate

        public boolean isUpToDate()
        Tests whether the vertices of this polygon have been updated to ensure this is a convex polygon.

        When this polygon is up-to-date, all operations are available. However, when this polygon is out-of-date, most of the operations on this will throw an OutdatedPolygonException. To update a polygon, please see ConvexPolygon2DBasics.update().

        Specified by:
        isUpToDate in interface ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly
        Returns:
        whether this is up-to-date or not.
